Character.name: mePhone
intro: mePhone: Look upon the face of sheer perfection, and tremble, little creature.
mePhone: You, my sad friend, are an ancient technology that has no place in this world any longer.
mePhone's eyes narrow, and he glares at you with pure contempt.

attacks.name: Humiliate
dialog: mePhone: I wonder why I'm so popular.  Is it my gorgeous design? My features? My power?
mePhone strikes a pose of such elegant style and grace that you start to feel bad about yourself.

attacks.name: Life of the Party
dialog: mePhone: You're funny. You know who might think you're funny?
mePhone scrolls through his impressively long list of social media friends with a smirk.
You feel a little bit alone right now.

attacks.name: From Thin Air
dialog: mePhone: Ugh. I'm bored. Fighting you is boring.
mePhone decides he'd like to play a new game, and conjures it from the ether.
Have your cartridges always been this heavy?

attacks.name: Embarrassing Selfie
dialog: mePhone: Smile for the world now!
mePhone turns around and takes a photo of himself looking glamorous, with you in the background.
You do not at all look glamorous, and you think he knows it.

conversations.prompt: mePhone: You look a little familiar. Are you one of those game devices I read about in history class?

followup: mePhone's eyes narrow, but he composes it into a look of smug satisfaction.
mePhone: Just because I am not one of a kind doesn't mean I'm not perfect.
mePhone: Besides, why wouldn't everyone have a mePhone?  We're simply the best choice.
mePhone looks pretty annoyed.
mePhone looks unfazed.

conversations.prompt: mePhone: It must be fun carrying big plastic cartridges everywhere you go.

replies.text: Is that a crack in your screen?
followup: mePhone: WHAT?!
mePhone panics, but, finding no crack, glares at you hatefully.
mePhone: How dare you?!
mePhone: There are some things we DO NOT joke about.
mePhone looks pretty annoyed.
mePhone looks a little irritated.

conversations.prompt: mePhone: So sad. No internet. No apps. No friends. So very alone. ...and ugly.

followup: mePhone guards his expression, as if hiding a glint of fear.
mePhone: True, but... I am the peak of technological perfection.  I'm not going anywhere.
mePhone sounds a little bit less than certain.
mePhone looks pretty annoyed.
mePhone looks a little annoyed.

conversations.prompt: mePhone: Enough of this! You are old, you are worthless, and your age is past!

replies.text: Look, they released a new mePhone!
followup: mePhone utterly loses it.
mePhone: WHAT?!  No... no, no, NO!
mePhone: This... this cannot be happening!
mePhone: It wasn't my time!  I want more life!
mePhone looks a little irritated.
mePhone looks pretty annoyed.

replies: mePhone seems to acknowledge the might of your speakers, but doesn't seem very bothered about it.
mePhone: Sure, you have speakers.  But I can connect to any sound system on the planet!
mePhone laughs himself silly at your screen.
mePhone: Oh, is that your display?  I'm sorry, I thought it was a mosaic.
mePhone seems to think your camera is adorable.
mePhone: Is that one whole tenth of a megapixel?  No?  Not even?
mePhone seems aware of the potential utility of your printer, but remains mostly unimpressed.
mePhone: Nice try, but, I think I'll stick to printing wirelessly, thank you.

win: mePhone seems to struggle to catch his breath, and it looks as though his life has just flashed before his screen.
mePhone: ...I was *sure* I was the best, but... I'm...
mePhone seems to contemplate his place in the universe as if for the first time.
mePhone: All these weeks of being young and handsome and popular, and now... it's over.
mePhone: I'll probably send the rest of my life in a drawer, or a closet somewhere...
mePhone: This will be my... my last broadcast.  I guess this is me, signing off.  Forever.
mePhone: Here. I doubt I'll be needing this receiver anymore.  Maybe you can use it, if I won't get to.
mePhone: It's funny... for as ugly, and gross, and boxy, and clunky, and beepy...
mePhone: ...and pixelated, and low-color, and heavy, and cumbersome...
mePhone: ...and battery-eating, and inconvenient, and out of print, and utterly obsolete as you are...
mePhone: ...I never really realized that... you're a classic.
mePhone: ...and I guess that's something I'll never be.
mePhone: ...good luck, you ugly little monster.  I hope you have a longer, happier life than I will.
mePhone: ...but, hey... I guess you already have.
lose: mePhone: Ha! Oh, this is going to get me SO many likes on my tweetBookstagram.
mePhone: Nice try, little freak.  I mean, not really, but... you know.
mePhone: Bother me again when you're... I dunno... less pathetic.  Later, loser.
